content: The Act may be cited as the "Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013" and includes definitions for key terms. The "Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013" defines key terms such as "Authority" as the Sabine River Authority of Texas and "Federal land" as specific areas within the Sabine National Forest and Toledo Bend Project boundary in Texas. The Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013 includes the wilderness area within the Sabine National Forest and the Toledo Bend Project boundary in Texas, as well as certain additional Federal land occupied by Forest Service campgrounds adjacent to the Toledo Bend Project. The Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013 involves the exchange of Federal land, including Forest Service campgrounds, adjacent to the Toledo Bend Project with non-Federal land owned or to be acquired by the Authority. The Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013 involves exchanging Federal land, including Forest Service campgrounds, near the Toledo Bend Project with non-Federal land owned or to be acquired by the Authority and mutually agreed upon by the Secretary. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service. The Toledo Bend Project is also mentioned in the context. The Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013 involves exchanging Federal land near the Toledo Bend Project with non-Federal land agreed upon by the Authority and the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary is defined as the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service. The Toledo Bend Project is identified as FERC project number 2305. The term "wilderness area" refers to the Indian Mounds Wilderness Area in the Sabine National Forest designated by the Texas Wilderness Act of 1984. The term "wilderness candidate land" refers to the surface estate of land adjacent to the Indian Mounds Wilderness Area in the Sabine National Forest, to be agreed upon by the Authority and the Secretary, owned or to be acquired by the Authority. SEC. 3. LAND EXCHANGE, SABINE NATIONAL FOREST. In exchange for non-Federal land, wilderness candidate land, and any cash payment, the Secretary will convey all US interests in Federal land to the Authority. The conveyance is subject to existing rights and an appraisal must be completed within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary will complete an appraisal of the surface estate of Federal land, non-Federal land, and wilderness candidate land within 180 days of the Act's enactment, following specific standards. The Secretary will appraise Federal land, non-Federal land, and wilderness candidate land within 180 days, following specific standards including the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions and the Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice. The appraisal will account for any restrictive covenants on the Federal land. The Secretary will appraise Federal, non-Federal, and wilderness candidate land within 180 days following specific standards. The appraisal will consider any restrictive covenants on the Federal land. The exact acreage and legal description of the land to be conveyed will be determined by a survey. The exact acreage and legal description of the Federal, non-Federal, and wilderness candidate land to be conveyed under subsection (a) will be determined by surveys or other means agreed upon by the Secretary and the Authority. The costs of the land exchange will be shared equally between the Authority and the Secretary. The land exchange under subsection (a) will be conducted on an equal value basis, with costs shared equally between the Authority and the Secretary. Title to the non-Federal land conveyed to the Secretary under this section must be acceptable and conform to title approval standards of the Attorney General for land acquisitions by the Federal Government. SEC. 4. BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT, INDIAN MOUNDS WILDERNESS AREA, SABINE NATIONAL FOREST. Boundary Adjustment: The Secretary will modify the boundaries of the wilderness area to exclude land within the Toledo Bend Project and include acquired wilderness candidate land. The Secretary will modify the boundaries of the wilderness area to exclude land within the Toledo Bend Project and include acquired wilderness candidate land. This involves removing land from wilderness designation and including acquired land as designated wilderness. The Secretary will designate land as wilderness and part of the National Wilderness Preservation System under section 3(a).
